verses.text: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: He daily increaseth lies and desolation; And they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, And oil is carried into Egypt.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath also a controversy with Judah, And \add will\add* punish Jacob according to his ways; According to his doings will he recompense him.
He took his brother by the heel in the womb, And by his strength he had power with God:
Yea, he had power over \add the\add* angel, and prevailed: He wept, and made supplication unto him: He found him \add in\add* Beth-el, and there he spake with us;
Even the \sc Lord\sc* God of hosts; the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* his memorial.
Therefore turn thou to thy God: Keep mercy and judgment, And wait on thy God continually.
\add He is\add* a merchant, the balances of deceit \add are\add* in his hand: He loveth to oppress.
And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: \add In\add* all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that \add were\add* sin.
And I \add that am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* thy God from the land of Egypt Will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as \add in\add* the days of the solemn feast.
I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, And used similitudes by the ministry of the prophets.
\add Is there\add* iniquity \add in\add* Gilead? surely they are vanity: They sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; Yea, their altars \add are\add* as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
And Jacob fled \add into\add* the country of Syria, And Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept \add sheep\add*.
And by a prophet the \sc Lord\sc* brought Israel out of Egypt, And by a prophet was he preserved.
Ephraim provoked \add him\add* to anger most bitterly: Therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, And his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.
